revised_title: A Comprehensive Study of Loosenesses and Their Treatments
tldr: The author, William Cockburn, examines the nature and causes of loosenesses, including diarrhea, lienteria, dysentery, and passio caeliaca. He discusses their symptoms, sorts, and cures, drawing from historical methods and medicines. Cockburn also critiques the use of the Fluxus Heptaticus as a disease category and provides insights into the effectiveness of Ipecacuanha as a treatment.
